text: Samuel Gustaf Hermelin (1744-1820) was born in Sweden. He owned big mining businesses in Lapland. He also was a diplomat and a cartographer. He went to college to learn about mining at the University of Uppsala. He moved to the United States. He became the ambassador from Sweden to the United States. He moved back to Sweden and started his own mining company there. ==References== Category:Ambassadors of Sweden Category:Cartographers Category:Mining Category:1744 births Category:1820 deaths
title: Samuel Gustaf Hermelin
